trans-unit.source: The SizeConverter class is used to convert from one data type to another.
Access this class through the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref> object.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.Drawing.SizeConverter"></xref> object.
Determines whether this converter can convert an object in the specified source type to the native type of the converter.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that can be used to get additional information about the environment this converter is being called from.
This may be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, so you should always check.
Also, properties on the context object may also return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The type you want to convert from.
This method returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this object can perform the conversion.
Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the given destination type using the context.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that can be used to get additional information about the environment this converter is being called from.
This can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the type you want to convert to.

This method returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Converts the specified object to the converter's native type.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that can be used to get additional information about the environment this converter is being called from.
This may be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, so you should always check.
Also, properties on the context object may also return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
An <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> object that contains culture specific information, such as the language, calendar, and cultural conventions associated with a specific culture.
It is based on the RFC 1766 standard.
The object to convert.
The converted object.
The conversion cannot be completed.
Converts the specified object to the specified type.
The most common type conversion is to and from a string type.
The default implementation calls the <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> method of the object if the object is valid and if the destination type is string.
If this method cannot convert the specified object to the destination type, it passes a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that can be used to get additional information about the environment this converter is being called from.
This may be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, so you should always check.
Also, properties on the context object may also return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
An <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> object that contains culture specific information, such as the language, calendar, and cultural conventions associated with a specific culture.
It is based on the RFC 1766 standard.
The object to convert.
The type to convert the object to.
The converted object.
The conversion cannot be completed.
Creates an object of this type by using a specified set of property values for the object.
This is useful for creating non-changeable objects that have changeable properties.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref> through which additional context can be provided.
A dictionary of new property values.
The dictionary contains a series of name-value pairs, one for each property returned from the <xref:System.Drawing.SizeConverter.GetProperties*> method.
The newly created object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the object could not be created.
The default implementation returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether changing a value on this object should require a call to the <xref:System.Drawing.SizeConverter.CreateInstance*> method to create a new value.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref> through which additional context can be provided.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Drawing.SizeConverter.CreateInstance*> object should be called when a change is made to one or more properties of this object.
Retrieves the set of properties for this type.
By default, a type does not have any properties to return.
An easy implementation of this method can call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetProperties%2A> method for the correct data type.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref> through which additional context can be provided.
The value of the object to get the properties for.
An array of <xref:System.Attribute> objects that describe the properties.
The set of properties that should be exposed for this data type.
If no properties should be exposed, this may return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The default implementation always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether this object supports properties.
By default, this is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref> through which additional context can be provided.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Drawing.SizeConverter.GetProperties*> method should be called to find the properties of this object.
